mcqs.question: ** You are working on a team project and one of your team members is not pulling their weight. What do you do?

options.A: Confront the team member and tell them they need to step up their game.
options.B: Try to compensate for the team member's lack of effort by doing more work yourself.
options.C: Talk to the team member and try to understand what's going on and see if there's a way to help them get back on track.
options.D: Go to the team leader and report the team member's lack of effort.

mcqs.assessment: If you chose the first option, you tend to be assertive and direct, but may also come across as confrontational or aggressive, whereas choosing the second option reveals that you tend to be a team player and willing to help out, but may also be a people-pleaser and take on too much work, and opting for the third option indicates that you tend to be empathetic and willing to listen, and are likely to be a good team player and problem-solver, but selecting the last option suggests that you tend to be avoidant and may not be willing to take responsibility for addressing the issue directly. This behavior can significantly impact your relationships with your team members and the overall success of the project. Your approach to handling a difficult team member can say a lot about your personality and behavior. It can also influence how others perceive you and interact with you in the team.

mcqs.question: ** You are given a new project with a tight deadline. What do you do?

options.A: Start working on the project right away and try to get as much done as possible.
options.B: Take some time to plan and prioritize the project before starting to work on it.
options.C: Ask for an extension on the deadline because you don't think you can get it done on time.
options.D: Delegate the project to someone else because you don't think you have the skills or expertise.

mcqs.assessment: If you chose the first option, you tend to be impulsive and action-oriented, but may also be prone to mistakes and burnout, which can be both beneficial and detrimental to your work, whereas choosing the second option reveals that you tend to be organized and strategic, and are likely to approach the project in a thoughtful and methodical way, allowing you to manage your time effectively and produce high-quality results. This behavior can be an indicator of your ability to work under pressure and manage your workload. Your approach to handling a new project with a tight deadline can reveal a lot about your work style and personality. It can also impact your productivity and overall job satisfaction.

mcqs.question: You are given a new task at work that you have never done before. What do you do?

options.A: Jump right in and try to figure it out as you go
options.B: Ask for guidance and support from your supervisor or colleagues
options.C: Take some time to research and learn about the task before starting
options.D: Avoid the task and try to delegate it to someone else

mcqs.assessment: The way this person approaches a new task at work reveals their underlying personality traits, such as being impulsive and reckless, diving headfirst into the task without proper planning or consideration, or collaborative and open to feedback, seeking guidance and support from colleagues, or proactive and self-directed, taking the initiative to learn and adapt, or avoidant and lacking initiative, hesitating to take on the new challenge, each response highlighting a unique facet of their behavior and work style.
